blitz Module¶

Module to handle integration with Bltiz.io. The service requires that a specific route give back a specific value. This is important so that it is not used on sites unknowingly.

class controllers.blitz.Blitz[source]¶

Controller class to handle Bltiz.io routes.

GET(action=None)[source]¶

Get for Blitz.io route

getFileMediaType(data)¶

Determine whether the file is an image or some other type of file.

getKeywordsJSON()[source]¶
getSimilarProjectsJSON()[source]¶
getSimilarResourcesJSON()[source]¶
getThumbUrl(media_type, media_id, max_width=None, max_height=None)¶

Get the URL to an image representation of the media. For images, this may be used for getting a thumbnail. Specify max width and height in that case. Otherwise you’ll probably just get a generic file image.

getThumbnailImageData(data, size)¶

Creates a thumbnail of the given size from the given image data. Return the image data in a string.

newFile()¶

Controller for the /create/attachment endpoint.

Parameters:

qqfile (required)
Contains the file to be uploaded.
max_width/max_height
The maximum width and height to use for the thumbnail image.
newProject()[source]¶
saveThumbnailImage(fs, media_type, media_id, data, name, size)¶
uploadFile()[source]¶

Handler for the /create/file endpoint. Looks for the variable named qqfile from the request and saves it to a file on the server.

Return information about the file in a dict with keys id, type, and name

uploadImage()[source]¶

addKeywords()[source]¶
addLink()[source]¶
addMessage()[source]¶

Add a message to the project discussion stream.

project_id – The id of the project main_text – The message contents attachment_id – (optional) The file attachment on the message. If no

file attachment is available, it should be an empty string or left off of the request entirely.
